item.title: CITIGROUP | Trade war is still passing by
item.description:
In early May, the great gamblers moved to the casinos of the territory. Citigroup admits that it may have somehow assisted revenge expenses, that is, intense consumption after periods of deprivation
In the early days of May, the impact of trade war between the US and China was not felt but casino tables. The scenario was outlined by the Citigroup Investment Bank, in the latest report on the game sector. The May 1st holiday coincides with the Golden Week in the countryside, one of the main vacation periods, and despite the most complicated economic environment worldwide, players, including VIP, did not fail to come to Macao. According to Citigroup, quoted by the GGR Asia portal, the “current commercial conflicts between China and the United States seem not to be discouraging players to enjoy gaming offers and non -Macao's playing elements,” he is written. Analysts George Choi and Timothy Chau even go further and consider that the observations made in the casinos were to leave “the jaw drop”, given the number of players. For this reality contributed the number of great gamblers, those who make bets over $ 1 million of Hong Kong per play, which were present at the tables. Analysts even hypothesized that they have assisted “revenge expenses”, an expression used to describe intense and high consumption after moments of deprivation. "It was the first time we came across more than a VIP player to bet several million dollars of Hong Kong the same day," they noted. "This probably suggests that current commercial conflicts between China and the US are not so far affecting players' preferences," Citi suggested. Full house However, it was not only in terms of VIP players that the game market showed a great vitality. The same happened at the mass level, with Citigroup indicating that the number of visitors, in the order of 220 thousand per day, presented averages higher than those of the Lunar New Year, another of the high seasons of tourism. Given these values, Citigroup indicates that the numbers show that there is a certain “lack of elasticity of demand for the game”, that is, that the demand for the game tends to suffer few variations, despite being affected by negative factors. In terms of market share among the six dealers, and taking into account the highest segment in the mass market, the premium segment, analysts pointed out that Sands China, Wynn Macau and MGM China get 63 percent of the market, with galaxy, Melco and SJM to get the remaining 37 percent. This trend was considered as within the expected. The bank also indicated that MGM China “jumped to first place with a quota of approximately 30 percent of observed premium mass bets” due to the presence of a great gambler who was betting about $ 2.9 million from Hong Kong.

item.title: Zone A | Air quality monitoring station in the gutter
item.description:
An air quality monitoring station in zone A of new landfills will be built. Regarding air quality, the SMG director referred to the descent of the atmospheric pollutants concentration in 2023, according to data from the large bay monitoring network. This although the quality air got worse in Macao in 2023 and 2024
After a sequence of dangerous or unhealthy air quality days, which even motivated the alert of meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) for the population to avoid going out, the body's director reported improvements in the air quality verified in 2023 at regional level. In a response to the written interpellation of Congressman Leong Weng Kun, he highlights the results of the regional levels and the work of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau air quality monitoring network to the Rio das Pearl Delta region. ” According to the SMG director, the 2023 report of the interregional network points out that “the annual average concentration values ​​of various atmospheric pollutants recorded by 2023 fell between 17 and 86 percent over peak levels”. Leong Weng Kun concludes that "emission reduction measures implemented by the three regions were effective in improving regional air quality." However, the annual statistics of the 2023 and 2024 environment of Macau paint a very different scenario. In 2023, more days were recorded with poor air quality compared to the previous year. In fact, the days with “unhealthy” and “moderate” air were much superior to those with “good” quality. The panorama worsened last year, according to environmental statistics the number of days with “unhealthy” and “very unhealthy” air quality increased to 2023. Beyond oxygen The SMG director also emphasizes the study prepared by the three regions to understand the causes of ozone in the large bay region and the transmission characteristics at the interregional level. Despite the descent of air quality, Leong Weng Kun states that "in recent years, the Government of MSAR has implemented a number of measures to improve air quality, including reducing atmospheric pollutants through incentive and regulation measures, aiming at ozone precursors." The official gives the examples of the prohibition of import and transit of paints for construction, inks for vehicles and stickers for decoration works high with volatile organic compounds. Regarding the monitoring of atmospheric pollution, Leong Weng Kun reveals that the preparatory work is currently “currently under way” to build an air quality monitoring station in zone A of new urban landfills ”.

item.title: Local Accommodation | Lo Choi in recognizes challenges, but asks study
item.description:
The deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen points out that, despite the ban on local accommodation in Macau, there are ads everywhere and that a simple search on the internet has offers for almost all tastes
Lo Choi in wants to know if the new government has plans to study the viability of local accommodation in Macao. The issue is part of an interpellation written by the deputy linked to the Jiangmen community, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. According to Lo Choi In, illegal pensions are currently found in a mixed regime, in which although they are prohibited, they have not been criminalized, which has made them present in Macao. In addition, it indicates, the increase in the number of a new type of tourists in the interior of China has also contributed to the search for these spaces to continue to grow. In this context, where the deputy asks if it would not be better to study the legal viability of local accommodation, since it becomes increasingly impossible to combat the phenomenon. "The law of the prohibition of illegal accommodation of accommodation did not criminalize the offer of local accommodation in Macao. The legislative intention went to leave margin so that in the future it could advance to legalization," said the deputy, who voted in favor of the proposal. "However, the law imposes an administrative sanction for the offer of local accommodation of 800 thousand patacas, which also reflects the concern of the community with illegal accommodation," he acknowledged. "Does competent services can take the initiative to join some academic institutions, community interest groups and study the viability of local accommodation to examine and explore the advantages and disadvantages to Macao?" À frente de todos Lo Choi also considers that despite the problems of illegal accommodation this is an increasingly present reality The deputy mentions that in recent times her cabinet has increasingly received complaints from residents, because in the buildings where they live, especially in the high times of tourism, it is increasingly frequent to see tourists from the interior of China to enter and get out of travel luggage. There were also complaints about tourists who address residents to ask where local accommodation is, without being aware that it is an illegal practice. In addition to the increase in the number of complaints received, LO indicates that online search on general search engines or accommodation offer show several illegal housing available in Macao. Given this growth, and given the illegalization, the deputy asks the government to intensify efforts to combat the phenomenon and to make a campaign for tourists to realize the risks they take, in case of accidents, for being these accommodation. Lo Choi In also asks the government to make the mechanisms more effective for denouncing illegal housing, especially through online media, which it considers to be the most effective.

item.title: Banking / SME | Prudence with credit due to economic climate
item.description:
The bank sector squeezed the credit assignment criteria to small and medium enterprises in the new interest bonus plan launched two weeks ago by the government. Andy Wu asks entrepreneurs to make a rigorous assessment of the risks of resorting to loans, at a time when the badoral credit continues at high levels
Yesterday two weeks ago the government launched another Bank Credit Interest Bonus Plan for Small and Medium Enterprises (SME), which will take place until April 22, 2026. After other similar plans, companies and sector representatives indicate that bank criteria for loan approval became more demanding compared to the plans applied during the pandemic period. The current plan foresees five million Patacas as a maximum amount of credits to be granted to each commercial entrepreneur, with a maximum three -year bonus period and the maximum limit of the annual bonus rate of 4 percent. A businessman, who did not want to identify to the newspaper or Mun, said he analyzed the criteria and details of the plan, being interested in relieving the liquidity pressure of the company. However, the entrepreneur noted that the requirements are more rigorous than those related to similar loans in 2021 and 2022. Although he thinks that he meets the approval criteria, the entrepreneur indicated to the world not being sure if he will be able to borrow. Also in anonymity condition, a bank sector professional indicated to the newspaper or Mun that banking institutions only took plans 2021 and 2022 as a reference, but that financial and economic environments have changed since then, forcing banks to change risk assessment criteria. As we arrived here Despite greater or less focus on social responsibility aspects, or fiduciary duties before shareholders, the professional heard by the newspaper or Mun considers that, in general, Macao banks assume a partnership position with the SMEs as part of their operative mission. As such, the source indicates that if companies have a registration without bad credit, credit requests will be accepted. At the same newspaper, the president of the Federal General Commercial Association of Small and Medium Enterprises of Macau, Andy Wu, suggested to the government, banking and trade and business associations that reinforce the dissemination of the criteria, formalities and deadlines of the interest bonus plan. The official said he understood the prudence of the bank and indicated to expect the entrepreneurs to be considered in the credit request, the assessment of risks and the operative capacity. The Malparado credit hit last February the highest value since 1990, the year the Monetary Authority of Macao (AMCM) began compiling this data. The latest AMCM data released last week for March and the first quarter of 2025 reveal that despite having down 2.7 percent, the debt to Macao banks was about 56.1 billion.

Hugo Schuchardt's interest in Luso-Asian Creole has been studied by Hugo Cardoso, a researcher and professor at the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon (FLUL), a Creole specialist who developed investigation at the University of Macao. The academic recently led a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. However, when he covered his correspondence, it is clear that Macau was also on his radar, since he discusses the Macao Creole with several of his correspondents, including Vasconcelos milk and Gonçalves Viana," he said. For the professor at FLUL, pioneering in the study of the Creoles is an expression that rhymes with Schuchardt. The German linguist was "absolutely pioneering in this domain, not only in the study of the Luso-Sasitive Creole or even the Portuguese Lexical Base Creoles globally, but in the study of Creole languages ​​in general" and, for this reason, is "a larger figure in the history of linguistics." Hugo Cardoso also points out that "as regards the Portuguese lexical base creoles, before him, there had been some activity, especially by Adolfo Coelho, who, in 1881, had published" Romanesque or Neo-Latin dialects in Africa, Asia and America, "in which he was a caught in various Portuguese-based Creole." However, in this work, Adolfo Coelho refers only to three Luso-Asiatic Creole: “Ceylon's (at Sri Lanka), Malaca and Macau's-giving some examples that he could get from previous publications (such as Macau's Ta-Ss-Yang-Kuo magazine)”. The academic has no doubt that “Hugo Schuchardt was surely inspired by Rabbit's work, but his efforts to obtain primary data from many other Asian places greatly expanded cartography of the Luso-sinical Creole and resulted in the first published news and the first grammatical descriptions of many of them (such as Diu, Cananor, Mahé, Mangar, Mangar, Mangar etc.) ”. Future inspirations According to Hugo Cardoso, the German linguist left works that inspired future academics and many materials from the personal archive. "One effect of his work was to inspire other agents to develop similar work: there stands out the figure of Sebastião Rodolfo Dalgado, who led his own research and made his own publications about the Indo-Portuguese Creoles that Schuchardt had not approached, about Damão, Bombaim, Ceylon and Negapath." In the case of José de Leite Vasconcelos, who wrote the letter cited at the beginning of this text, "it also corresponded with Schuchardt and reveals, in his linguistic studies, the impact of Schuchardt's work." Asked by HM about the possible interconnections between the Creole of IUD, Batávia and Macao, Hugo Cardoso states that there are "continuities between the various Luso-Asian Creole, but also many differences." "The Batávia/Tugu Creole is the one that most resembles Creole de Macao, for example, at the Lexicon level. But this is understandable because it has already shown that Macao Creole has an important historical connection with the Creole that developed in Southeast Asia, in particular Malaca." In the case of Creoles of Portuguese origin in the southern Asia area, they emerged from the arrival of Vasco da Gama to Calecute, India, in 1498, especially from the phase in which the entire base of the Portuguese empire the East focuses on Goa. item.title: Must | “Hug of Love” and other works, by Leong Kit Man, on display
item.description:
The University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must, in the English acronym) hosts until Sunday the show of Leong Kit Man, with several paintings, where the creation “Hug of Love” stands out. These are works funded by the Young Talent Support Program of Artistic Creation of the National Arts Fund of China, in its edition of 2024, curated by Julia Kwan
Leong Kit Man, a young local artist, exposes his work "Hug of Love" until this Sunday at the University of Science and Technology of Macau (Must, in the English acronym). It is a large painting, with 4.8 by 4.8 meters, the result of an artistic project funded by the Youth Talent Support Program of Artistic Creation of the China National Arts Fund of 2024. According to a Must statement, this is a painting where flowers and birds gain prominence, breaking “with the traditional composition of topographic painting”. According to a curator's note, Julia Lam Tsz Kwan, the artist “unites [in painting] human landscapes and a centenary tree in a vision through segmented color blocks, with diverse elements, including the ancestral tree that symbolizes the life cycle, nests that symbolize homes, creation of pups that represent the adoption and inheritance, and precede plates that evoke prayers”. All of these elements “mean human growth”, read in the same note. In addition to this great picture, the public can also see “six original large -scale paintings of flowers and birds, along with preparatory designs, sketches and color studies of the artist”. The show also includes “a special digital animation” framed with the painting “Hug of Love”. This set of works indicates that “beyond the technical inheritance, the evolution of Chinese painting is in line with the continuous pioneering of new artistic expressions”. All of these works can be seen free of charge on the fourth floor of Must's block. Style In the same note, it is noteworthy that Leong Kit Man has been looking for more than a decade for over a decade, “merging the gongbi-style meticulous brush, with textures material, in order to obtain a distinct style, while exploiting and expanding infinite possibilities of the oriental [artistic] media”. It should be noted that the Gongbi style is, in Chinese painting, synonymous with detail and precision in how the various elements are portrayed, in order to give a sense of great realism to those who look at the works. For this style of painting, specific brushes are used in order to obtain certain types of lines and contours, according to the objective that the artist wants to achieve. Mo Xiaoye, exhibition advisor and professor at the Department of Fine Arts at Zhejiang University of Science and Technology, said that the play “Hug of Love” represents “from a single perspective, the Macau Peninsula seen from far from Cotai”. For the academic, this painting also allows “a highly creative and successful rereading of Macau's topographic painting, breaking with conventional formats”. The artist herself explains that this work "has as its backdrop the urban landscape of Macao dramatically transformed 25 years after the transfer [Portuguese administration from Macau to China], with a centenary tree as a central piece to look at us, who passed through it." Doctorate in Fine Arts from the National Academy of Arts of China, artist, academic and curator, Leong Kit Man is assistant teacher of Fine Arts and Master's Supervisor and PhD at the Faculty of Humanities and Arts of Must. The artist also had works selected for the China National Art Exhibition in 2014, 2019, and 2024. Highlight for the work “Emplendor Efémeus”, which was chosen to join the Exhibition of Select Works of the National Exhibition of Fine Arts of 2019 in Beijing. The artist won several awards at Macau's annual visual arts exhibition.

item.title: Victory Day | China sends guard of honor to parades in Moscow
item.description: The China army will send a guard of honor to the Victory Day parades in Moscow, where Chinese President Xi Jinping should attend the Russian homologist Vladimir Putin in Red Square. The China Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that it will send a guard of honor to participate in the military parades in the capitals of Russia and Belarus, to mark the 80th anniversary of the defeat of Germany Nazi, which is celebrated this Friday. Beijing sent Moscow Honor Guards to a Victory Day commemorative parade in 2015, but this will be the first time a Chinese guard of honor will participate in a similar event in Minsk. According to Chinese analysts, the gesture aims to demonstrate support for the International Order of Post World War, which Beijing considers to be under threat. Videos released on Chinese social networks showed the rehearsals of Chinese soldiers in Minsk and Moscow last week. As part of the preparations for the Moscow Parade, Chinese soldiers rehearsed the “Guerrilla Song” in Red Square on Sunday, described the Global Times, the Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper. The patriotic song describes the difficulties faced by Chinese soldiers during the Japanese invasion. Official News Agency Xinhua said this year is important to China and Russia, as well as “all those who love peace around the world,” as it also marks the 80th anniversary of the end of the invasion of Japan in China. Xinhua added that China and Russia will "defend written history with blood and lives, and oppose any attempt or behavior that seeks to deny, distort or falsify the history of World War II." Beijing had already announced that Xi will visit Russia between Wednesday and Saturday, and will maintain a “strategic dialogue” with Putin.

item.description: A high Hamas employee said yesterday that the Palestinian group considers it useless at this stage negotiations for a truce in Gaza, and appealed to the world to press Israel to end the “hunger war” at the enclave. "It is not worth starting negotiations or examining new ceasefire proposals while the Hunger War and the Gaza Extermination War continues," France-Presse (AFP) Bassem Naïm, a member of the Hamas political office, told the agency. "The world must press the government of Netanyahu to end the crimes of hunger, thirst and murder," he added. The statements appear a day after the Israelite government announced a new military campaign in the Gaza Strip, which provides for the conquest of the territory. The Gaza Strip, where the inhabitants have been displaced several times, has been under a blockade of Israel since March 2 and crosses a serious humanitarian crisis. Gaza Civil Defense spokesman Mahmoud Baçal said yesterday that three Palestinians were killed following Israeli bombing at dawn in different parts of the Gaza Strip. The Israelite army resumed the enclave offensive on March 18, ending a two -month truce. The war was triggered by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, which caused the death of 1,218 people on the Israeli side, mostly civilians, according to an AFP count based on official data. Of the 251 kidnapped people, 58 remain arrested in Gaza, 34 of which were declared killed by the Israelite army. Hamas also maintains the remains of an Israeli soldier killed during a previous war in Gaza in 2014. The Israeli retaliation campaign made at least 52,567 killed in Gaza, most of Civil, according to Hamas Ministry of Health, considered UN reliable.

item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco's integrated resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023 ″. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unwavering, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our food and drink points in Macao and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

Hugo Schuchardt's interest in Luso-Asian Creole has been studied by Hugo Cardoso, a researcher and professor at the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon (FLUL), a Creole specialist who developed investigation at the University of Macao. The academic recently led a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. However, when he covered his correspondence, it is clear that Macau was also on his radar, since he discusses the Macao Creole with several of his correspondents, including Vasconcelos milk and Gonçalves Viana," he said. For the professor at FLUL, pioneering in the study of the Creoles is an expression that rhymes with Schuchardt. The German linguist was "absolutely pioneering in this domain, not only in the study of the Luso-Sasitive Creole or even the Portuguese Lexical Base Creoles globally, but in the study of Creole languages ​​in general" and, for this reason, is "a larger figure in the history of linguistics." Hugo Cardoso also points out that "as regards the Portuguese lexical base creoles, before him, there had been some activity, especially by Adolfo Coelho, who, in 1881, had published" Romanesque or Neo-Latin dialects in Africa, Asia and America, "in which he was a caught in various Portuguese-based Creole." The academic has no doubt that “Hugo Schuchardt was surely inspired by Rabbit's work, but his efforts to obtain primary data from many other Asian places greatly expanded cartography of the Luso-sinical Creole and resulted in the first published news and the first grammatical descriptions of many of them (such as Diu, Cananor, Mahé, Mangar, Mangar, Mangar etc.) ”. Asked by HM about the possible interconnections between the Creole of IUD, Batávia and Macao, Hugo Cardoso states that there are "continuities between the various Luso-Asian Creole, but also many differences." item.title: Electricity cut affects Portugal, Spain and parts of southern France
item.description: A flaw of electricity affected, at 11:33 (18h33 in Macao), Portugal, Spain and some areas of southern France. In the first moments, information and speculation about the cause of the blackout were disseminated, namely in relation to a possible large-scale cyberataque, a hypothesis that was not excluded in the first instance by the General Secretariat of Internal Administration. Until the closing of this issue, the cause was not yet clear, nor was there an estimate for the return of electricity, but Prime Minister Luís Montenegro said he had hope that the light supply would be resumed yesterday, according to Lisbon time (7 less for Macau). However, there were news in Portuguese media that pointed to the return of electricity in various parts of the country, as well as in Spain. The Expresso newspaper cited data collected by the operators of the electricity network in the Iberian peninsula that pointed to tension imbalances as an explanation for the "blackout" rather than a cyberatheck designed to affect energy infrastructures. Until the closing of this edition, the Portuguese government did not rule out any explanation for the incident. The e-nodes warned that the forecast of electricity replacement remained indefinite and could be prolonged, without advance an estimate. "Given the problems of the network that persist the forecast of energy replacement remains undefined and may be prolonged," said the operator of the electricity distribution network in mainland Portugal, in a statement. E-Redes reiterated that the supply of electricity in Portugal was being affected by upstream constraints of the distribution network, in the very high voltage network in Spain. According to REN - national power grid, yesterday's blackout may have been caused by abnormal temperature fluctuations in Spain. The news was advanced by the BBC, which mentions an atmospheric phenomenon. Pandemonium scenario The incident caused chaos in the country. At airports, check-ins became manuals and began to be announced on flights at first, but were eventually canceled. TAP has issued a statement to appeal to passengers so as not to go to airports, as operation is temporarily conditioned due to blackout. Rail traffic was also totally interrupted throughout the Iberian Peninsula. In hospitals, emergency generators and emergency services and surgeries have been prioritized to respond to urgent cases. In addition to the Emergency Meeting of the Council of Ministers, the National Operational Coordination Center, which is part of the entities in the context of protection and relief operations, gathered to follow the situation and adopt the necessary procedures due to the lack of energy in mainland Portugal. The telephone and computer systems of the National Institute of Emergency Medical was operating until the closing of this edition using generators and the fuel supply posts interrupted the services. On the other hand, the Águas de Portugal (ADP) group appealed to water consumption only for essential uses, “very moderate”, and said there were only “punctual failures”. Heard by Lusa regarding the widespread cutting of electricity and a possible water failure, the company's official source warned that there may be consumer constraints, although without advanced more concrete data. ADP, which brings together more than a dozen water suppliers on the continent, "appeals to the use of water for the essentials only." "ADP is following the situation in all companies," the source said. The company, he added, intends to ensure that essential services have water and recalled that reservoirs have water but it takes energy to transport it, and that even the buildings themselves need energy to get water to consumers taps.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Facilitated automatic passage from foreign visitors
item.description:
In the presentation of this year's security lines for security, Wong Sio Chak referred to the idea of ​​facilitating the entry into Macau to foreign visitors, with the creation of more automatic passage points
The Secretary for Security announced, on Friday, plans to accelerate the border control of foreign visitors through the use of automatic electronic channels. During the presentation of the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) to 2025 in the area of ​​security, Wong Sio Chak stated that the territory will extend the use of automatic passage points to foreign citizens without resident or work authorization. To facilitate “exterior exchanges”, authorities will expand autoservice equipment to the biometric data collection system, which will apply to all foreign visitors, the leader explained. To the deputies at the Legislative Assembly, the secretary added that the government will continue to optimize iris recognition technology in border controls and to study its extension to non-residents this year. "We are also studying ways to widen the number of users eligible for automatic passage channels, allowing more foreign tourists to benefit from faster immigration processes and more fluid circulation in the large bay," Wong said. Speech and company In his speech, the secretary stated that "regarding the creation of a higher level of opening abroad, the input and output services will continue to be optimized and the facilitation measures of the border passage, to ensure a safe, effective, efficient and comfortable passage." Thus, "with a view to promoting the exchange with the outside, the automatic passage channels will also have foreigners, so that they deal with the input and exit inspection formalities through these channels." According to official data, Macau received, in 2024, 34.9 million visitors, 23.8 percent than the previous year, but only 2.42 million were international tourists. In October last year, the Chinese Foreign Ministry extended the Portuguese visa exemption policy, thus inserting Portugal into a list that already covered another 16 European countries. The measure, which allows the Portuguese to stay in China for tourism, business or traffic for a maximum of 15 days, in force at least until December 31, 2025. In the same month, Continental China had announced the expansion, from 90 to 180 days, from the permanence period for foreign residents of Macao on multiple entries in the country. The measure includes permanent and non-permanent foreign residents of Macao that move “to the interior of China for short-term tourism, trade, visit to family members, visits and other activities”. From July, the Chinese National Immigration Administration (NIA) had already allowed foreign permanent residents from Macao and Hong Kong to request authorization to enter the interior of China, valid for a maximum of five years. The measure covers members of the Portuguese community who are permanent residents in Macao and, until then, were required to ask for a visa to travel to the other side of the border.

item.title: April 25 | The Revolution of Cloves seen by the Chinese press
item.description:
The fall of the Estado Novo on April 25, 1974 was reported by the Chinese language press in Macao. Community concerns were revealed, namely about the permanence of the Noble Governor of Carvalho for stability and good business environment, as well as the “status quo” of Macau in the context of decolonization
The echoes of the April 25, 1974 revolution were late in Macao, but this did not mean absence of news in the following days, including the local Chinese press. HM consulted some of the news of the Chinese newspapers of the time over this period, translated to Portuguese by employees of the Press Censorship Commission (CCI), the public body that worked in Macao during the Portuguese dictatorial regime. This material is today to keep the Historical-Diplomatic Archive of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Lisbon. Its reading allows not only to realize some of the events that succeeded the revolution, but also the perceptions and concerns that the Chinese community had on what happened in Portugal. The Chinese wanted to maintain the stability and continuation of business. And if the Noble Governor of Carvalho, in power since 1966, was, for many, connoted with the fascist regime, and therefore had to leave, the truth is that many wanted their permanence to ensure social peace. As read in the book “Macao in the years of the 1974-1979 Portuguese Revolution”, by Garcia Leandro, former Portuguese governor, “Macao's Chinese sought, above all, stability to be able to continue quietly to their business, and did not want conflicts or misunderstandings with Beijing or Canton”. Administration was “weak, very badly supported technically and to be easily corrupted”, so there were “strong reasons for the local MFA [Movement of the Forces] and the CDM [Macao Democratic Center] want to change, especially for the permanent corruption and the sense of excessive weakness of the Portuguese administration, which seemed nothing to decide without preview of Chinese representatives”. MFA explanations Shortly after April 25, Macau was visited by two MFA representatives, namely Major Rebelo Gonçalves and Garcia Leandro himself, to explain the revolution and objectives of MFA to Portugal and the colonies, not just to the population but to journalists. One of the meetings, with local journalists, was described by the Tai Chung newspaper on May 6, 1974. "Rebelo Gonçalves received the reporters and narrated them in detail the coup d'état. On the day (of the event), the song" Who sends the people "served as a sign of action." The CCI translator attributed to the song “Grandola, Vila Morena”, by José Afonso, chosen to be the second password of the revolution on the radio, the name “Who Mandates is the people”, in reference to the verse of the letter “The people are the one who orders the most”. The news continued, quoting Rebelo Gonçalves: he said "that the coup d'état was the desire of the people, so it achieved success in the period of one day." Support to Nobre de Carvalho Fallen the regime in Lisbon, and exiled Marcelo Caetano, the issue of the Governor's permanence at the head of the destinations of Macao was quickly asked. However, Nobre de Carvalho received popular support to continue, as described from the news of the newspaper SI Man, October 4, 1974. "Portugal does not intend to modify Macau's status quo, a Portuguese delegate told Chinese traders. This delegate manifests himself pleased with the governor's re-competition campaign, promoted by several social sectors. However, Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho had already requested the dismissal of the position of governor for health reasons." In addition, a group was created “for the collection of signatures in favor of the renewal of Mr. General Nobre de Carvalho in the position of Governor of Macao”, which were handed over to Garcia Leandro, still as MFA official. This one received "two boxes containing signatures-cadenic books." "Opinions of entities of industrial and commercial circles were transmitted, hoping that the governor can remain in Macao, which given his wide experiences and knowledge of conditionalisms, can overcome the difficulties resulting from the economic decline that now happens around the world." But if the desire for many was the continuity of Nobre Carvalho, the departure of many civil servants began to be connoted with the change of regime. As referred to in the news of the Jornal Si Man, May 11, 1974. “The head of health and assistance services, Dr. António Joaquim Paulino, will return on the 27th of this month to mainland Portugal, which is reported to fall from Marcelo Caetano's government. The competent authorities refused to comment on the departure of Dr. Paulino.” The newspaper also added: "However, news from Fidente Fonte reported: It is believed that the unappropriate return to Lisbon of Dr. Paulino, whose service commission in this province has not yet ended, is related to the coup (continental). Still in early May, there were still many questions unanswered, and the newspaper SI Man associated the departure of Vasco Rocha Vieira from the territory, at the time of the military command of the Military Command, with the absence of explanations for the political situation. “A fortnight has passed a fortnight after the coup d'état in Portugal has been fully clarified that the political situation of that country was fully clarified. Although Macau is little affected by the event, the chief of staff of Portuguese troops parked in Macao, Major Rocha Vieira yesterday, which led many people to conjecture and suspect the junta of national salvation. Portuguese government had already started acting in Macau. ” Ho Yin's explanations Tai Chung Pou newspaper reported, on May 22, 1974, that "some Portuguese declared in Hong Kong that they were unhappy with the measures taken by the governor and the government of Macao", followed "for the metropolis to ask for the granting of freedom to the Portuguese of Macao." Ho Yin, a striking entrepreneur and figure of the local Chinese community, who dialogue directly with the governor representing the Chinese authorities, explained in a session with “foreign reporters, as well as those of Hong Kong and Macau” about April events. These “visited Mr. Ho Yin, asking him for opinion,” describes Tai Chung Pou. And once again, Ho Yin appealed his spirits, noting that Nobre Carvalho had all the legitimacy to continue as governor. "Since the Portuguese coup d'état, registered on April 25, Macau, given its special circumstances, has been felt, to date, very quiet, not undergoing any change. Mr. Governor, General Nobre de Carvalho, who has been in Macao for over seven years, has deep knowledge of the conditions of this city, having resolved many matters through conversations and wrowning great efforts to this city," Ho Yin told the journalists, according to the journalists, according to the journalists. newspaper report. At the same meeting, the possibility of dissolution of the Legislative Assembly, proposal of the CDM, was questioned. But Ho Yin pushed any sudden political change. “It is known that the Macao Democratic Center, consisting of some Portuguese, requested the dissolution of the Legislative Assembly and the Municipal Council [Leal Senate], as well as the remodeling of some public services. Some inhabitants thought that the assertions of that center would affect the social order, but they came to know that they were only the opinion of a small number of Portuguese, when the city is still the city quiet, after a few days. ” The newspaper adds that Nobre de Carvalho publicly explained "that Al would not be dissolved, so the population of Macao became carefree and entrusted in the prosperity of this city." In addition, “tourists from Hong Kong, as well as abroad, also think Macao is quiet and is not affected at all,” read in Tai Chung Pou. The Seng Pou newspaper also reported this meeting between Ho Yin and journalists, in which the Chinese community leader commented on the benefits of a democratic regime. "Given their peculiar circumstances and due to the fact that the Portuguese and Chinese respected themselves and live in peace for a long time, Macau has not suffered any repercussions resulting from that Portuguese coup," Ho Yin said, stressing that "as for the freedom of the word, it has always existed in Macau." However, the entrepreneur appealed to some containment in the political criticism made. "Democracy and freedom that are now verified in mainland Portugal are happiness to the Portuguese people. And the Portuguese and Chinese have lived in the past in peace, and it is expected to continue to succeed in the future. In the then, criticism of private people or public offices must be founded, since any thoughtless attack would make complications to the question, and affect its tranquility and prosperity." Macau without decolonization One of the questions emanating from April 25, 1974 was the most urgent process of decolonization in the so -called Portuguese Africa where the colonial war was due since 1961. First of all, the authorities clarified that Macau would be left out of this process, because “the Popular Republic of China was careful that in 1972, in the UN decolonization committee, to make it very clear that the future of these two European possessions [Macao and Hong and Hong Kong] would not be part of the agenda of the activities of that body, being the subject treated bilaterally, ”reads in the book of Garcia Leandro. item.title: Elderly | Recognizes difficulties in social companies
item.description: The Institute of Social Action (IAS) recognizes that the new trade environment has negatively affected the only two social companies that have among its functions to hire elderly workers. The current scenario was outlined in response to an interpetement of Deputy Lei Chan U, linked to the Federation of Macao Workers' Associations (Faom). item.title: Local Accommodation | Lo Choi in recognizes challenges, but asks study
item.description:
The deputy linked to the community of Jiangmen points out that, despite the ban on local accommodation in Macau, there are ads everywhere and that a simple search on the internet has offers for almost all tastes
Lo Choi in wants to know if the new government has plans to study the viability of local accommodation in Macao. The issue is part of an interpellation written by the deputy linked to the Jiangmen community, released on the Legislative Assembly portal. According to Lo Choi In, illegal pensions are currently found in a mixed regime, in which although they are prohibited, they have not been criminalized, which has made them present in Macao. In addition, it indicates, the increase in the number of a new type of tourists in the interior of China has also contributed to the search for these spaces to continue to grow. In this context, where the deputy asks if it would not be better to study the legal viability of local accommodation, since it becomes increasingly impossible to combat the phenomenon. "The law of the prohibition of illegal accommodation of accommodation did not criminalize the offer of local accommodation in Macao. The legislative intention went to leave margin so that in the future it could advance to legalization," said the deputy, who voted in favor of the proposal. "However, the law imposes an administrative sanction for the offer of local accommodation of 800 thousand patacas, which also reflects the concern of the community with illegal accommodation," he acknowledged. "Does competent services can take the initiative to join some academic institutions, community interest groups and study the viability of local accommodation to examine and explore the advantages and disadvantages to Macao?" Ahead of all Lo Choi also considers that despite the problems of illegal accommodation this is an increasingly present reality The deputy mentions that in recent times her cabinet has increasingly received complaints from residents, because in the buildings where they live, especially in the high times of tourism, it is increasingly frequent to see tourists from the interior of China to enter and get out of travel luggage. There were also complaints about tourists who address residents to ask where local accommodation is, without being aware that it is an illegal practice. In addition to the increase in the number of complaints received, LO indicates that online search on general search engines or accommodation offer show several illegal housing available in Macao. Given this growth, and given the illegalization, the deputy asks the government to intensify efforts to combat the phenomenon and to make a campaign for tourists to realize the risks they take, in case of accidents, for being these accommodation. Lo Choi In also asks the government to make the mechanisms more effective for denouncing illegal housing, especially through online media, which it considers to be the most effective.

item.title: Banking / SME | Prudence with credit due to economic climate
item.description:

item.title: Worker Day | Detained in the first protest in six years
item.description:
Police detained on the day of the worker a man protesting the number of migrant workers in Macao, invoking violation of the Law of Meeting and Manifestation Law. Also the Power of the People's Association canceled a demonstration, after the authorities suggested not wanting to debut the application of the law on the security of the state
On May 1, Labor Day, a man was arrested by agents of the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) when manifested against the importation of non-resident workers. CPSP source told Lusa that man showed 'slogans' (slogans) and chanting chants to demand the reduction of migrant workers at the door of the management services for the first public protest on May 1, 2019, before the COVID-19 pandemic. A video that circulates on social networks shows the man to put eight sheets of paper on the floor with the message “Government, cut on migrant workers! next to the flags of Macao and China. The Mishes was employed at the end of March nearly 183,400,000 migrant workers, still far from the maximum peak of 196,538, hit in late 2019 at the beginning of the pandemic. According to the CPSP, the agents made repeated warnings for violations of the Law of Meeting and Manifestation Law, but the man refused to obey and was taken to the squad to be identified. During the pandemic, security forces refused to approve the course of any protest, invoking reasons for “order and safety” or public health. Authorities raised anti-standard restrictions at the end of 2023, but the protests did not return to the city streets. These prohibitions arrived at the UN Human Rights Committee, which in 2022 evaluated "an increasing number of information of improper restrictions on the exercise of freedom of peaceful manifestations." It would be a pity The Power of the People's Association, which also requires a reduction in the number of migrant workers, canceled a manifestation planned for Labor Day due to “police pressure,” the All About Macau newspaper reported on Thursday. The association said it expected 20,000 participants, but canceled the event after police claimed that it could violate the National Security Act. Group President Lam Weng Ioi said he filed a formal statement of demonstration in April, but was summoned to repeated police meetings to "analyze the situation" and "avoid uncontrollable circumstances." Lam claimed that the authorities raised questions about the “joint responsibility of the organizers” and the warning of “National Security”, which led the group to present a written appeal. Speaking to the Macao TDM channel, the associative leader said that the authorities advanced various possibilities such as the intervention of “people with bad intentions” that could take advantage of the activities to create confusion, or from participants who could compromise public order, and that the association would be responsible for any disorder or irregularity. "We said we were going to have a special team to maintain order. However, police officers doubted our ability to control local order," Lam Weng Ioi told public television. The authorities also suggested that the manifestation of Labor Day could infringe national security laws. "It was mentioned, indirectly, (the violation of) law on the defense of state security. I was told that there was no detention, previously, based on this law and that they did not want us to be the first case of law on the defense of state security," said the president of the Power of the People Association. The PSP confirmed that it had received a statement notification for May 1, but said the organizer removed it voluntarily. Au Kam San disagree Following the case of the individual detained for protesting the importation of non-resident workers to Macao, at the gates of the management of services for labor affairs, on the day of the worker, former deputy Au Kam San argued that the act concerned was not a demonstration. As such, the action of public security police officers was not correct. In a Facebook publication, the former deputy disagreed with the police argument that the subject had not prior notice to the demonstration because he is only an individual and a small-scale protest and that the concept of manifestation depends on the number of people involved. Even so, it pointed out that there is no necessary authorization for notice of demonstration, a fundamental right provided for in the basic law of masters.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence on Sex in Macau
item.description: I had the experience of asking the most popular artificial intelligence platform that themes about sex, sexuality and gender would make sense to discuss in Macau. The answer brought three proposals that, although not very surprising, I found it interesting. Of course the platform used some creative and intellectual freedom - which I didn't ask for - to invent sources, quotes and points of view. Basically, he went to seek what is already known about Taiwan and Hong Kong, about the growing opening to LGBTQI+themes, and tried to make parallels with Macao. He mentioned the rainbow of Macau/澳門彩虹/Rainbow of Macau as the most active association in defending LGBTQI+ rights in the territory, and even invented interviews with its founder, with fictional quotes. The first proposal that artificial intelligence suggested is about Macao young people and their opening to non-binary and plural gender identities as a way of navigating western and oriental cultural identities, and monitoring generational changes. Worldwide we have seen an emancipation movement in this area, with many young people to discuss these issues openly. If in some countries institutions and policies follow these changes (and in others until retreat), in Macao the pit may be higher, taking into account its geographical situation. I went looking for studies that deepened the subject and found one who asked young people from Macau between 18 and 25 years old. The authors have analyzed how adherence to polyculturalism, the idea that crops are interconnected and influence each other, associated with lower levels of sexual prejudice, including negative attitudes towards LGBTQ+people. The study suggests that the cultural diversity of Macao, and the belief that cultures mingle, can create a predisposition to also accept sexual diversity. But I would say that it is still necessary to explore more about these issues, listening to real testimonies about the experiences of young people living in Macao. The second proposal - which I have mentioned here without account - has to do with the lack of accessible, inclusive and focused sex education, promoting more knowledge and pleasure in Macao and worldwide. If a few months ago I gave the example of Hong Kong, where it was suggested to play Badminton as a way to manage sexual abstinence, I would say that Macau is not much more open to talking about sex than that. This lack of discussion creates a series of complications that, due to the absence of data in the region, do not even know the true dimension of the problem. The absence of comprehensive and inclusive sex education increases the risk of sexual violence, discrimination and propagation of sexually transmitted infections. The third proposal surprised me, because it is a theme in which I rarely think: the growth of LGBTQia+ tourism in Asia and the opportunity that Macau has to bet on this niche. Since the hotel industry is the pillar of the economy of Macao, it would make sense to embrace this opportunity, as they have already made Thailand and Taiwan, creating LGBTQIA+spaces, or with specific events, such as Pride Month celebrations. According to some data produced online, this type of tourism is profitable and growing. Artificial intelligence even has interesting ideas, although something generic. But I confess that I was pleased to realize that the algorithm is in tune to defend the rights of sexual minorities and has an inclusive discourse. It becomes dangerous, however, when it begins to invent data and information just so that the argument sounds good. Still, in general, it can be a useful tool for discussing these issues without judgment. As the platform itself says, it has the potential to “combat myths, spread ethical concepts and include perspectives of marginalized groups, democratizing access to more complete and positive sex education.” In this suggestion of content creation, it seemed aligned with these values. If you will ever replace the work of people like me, who write on these topics, or the work of sexual educators… maybe it's too early to draw conclusions. Sensitive and thinking people still have a lot to contribute.

item.title: Saint Valentine's Day in the Czech Republic
item.description: Em Macau, muitas pessoas sabem que o 1.º de Maio é o Dia do Trabalhador e é um feriado oficial. O mesmo se passa na China continental, marcando o 1.º de Maio o início de um longo feriado. However, few know that in the Republic checked May 1st is the "Day of St. Valentine". On Valentine's Day, Czech lovers follow tradition and kiss under the cherry trees, singing songs to love. And the kiss why? According to Czech folklore, if a girl is not kissed under a cherry tree on St. Valentine's day, she will "wither" next year, losing "youth and charm." Therefore, a kiss means "protection and blessings." And what is “protection in love”? In mid -2015, Sean Lau, the winner of the Hong Kong's best actor's best actor award for his work in the movie “Overheard 3”, presented the “Space Nave Theory”. He used a simple phrase to show how his wife Amy Kwok protected him: “When I enter a spaceship and travel anywhere in the universe, you always find a way to bring me back to Earth safely.” The meaning of this phrase is simple and clear. If you are where you are, face what to face, you always bring me back safely. You are always by my side, making me be loved, hot, happy and in peace. Apart from the “spacecraft theory”, there is another sean Lau phrase that is part of the “passionate quotes for my wife”: "One day you no longer want to love love, you just want someone who doesn't leave you." Does true love require two people to stay together? In March 2025, news was released in Taiwan, China, saying that a woman had published an online article, where she said she had a boyfriend six years ago, but eventually found out that he was getting married to another. And this happened because her boyfriend loved her so much and didn't want her to go through the suffering caused by her relationship with her mother-in-law, so she decided to marry a woman from whom her parents liked, but he didn't like and assured his girlfriend that his "relationship" would not be affected. After marrying another woman, she would date forever with her beloved. Love implies "protection and blessings." Is it in favor of the “spacecraft theory” or “Nora/mother -in -law theory”? What are "blessings"? In Taiwan, China, the host of the television program “Yu Meiren”, (Yu Yunjie) had no contact with her in -laws for a long time. Once went to court due to a disagreement between mother and husband. Finally, the judge stated that his 16 -year marriage had come to an end. Later, Yu Meiren has lost a lot of weight, but now it is more beautiful than before and at his disposal has changed. She stated: "The French believe that in love we should accept those who come and we should not retain those who want to leave. 'When love happens, we must be ourselves, follow our hearts and act without schemes. When love is over, we must respect the other and not try to arrest or force it, which means that" letting out is the best of blessings. " Do you agree with the phrase “letting go is the best of blessings, the blessing is the best relief”? Hong Kong Cine Cine Cine Cenilia Cheung once expressed some disappointment after the divorce: "In love there is only one thing that can hurt us, it is the unwillingness. When we cannot live with ourselves, we inflicted pain." Perhaps that “protection and blessings” have different meanings for each person, but for me, "I have to say this only once. After all these years, I still love you."
