item.title: Trump and the politicization of time and climate
item.description: The disagreements between Trump and meteorologists are not new. Already in the first administration he directed by him there were disagreements that echoed in the US and international press. Its intrusion in predictions about the evolution of Hurricane Dorian in 2019 caused the “American Meteorological Society” (AMS) and the “National Weather Association (NWA) to diffuse a joint statement that there would likely be damage caused by the weather in the state of Alabama, as Mr. Trump had vatified. Perhaps for this reason, the then president of the United States of America may have been hating meteorologists and, by dragging, climatologists. Note that being a meteorologist is different from being a climatologist. The meteorologist, among other functions, analyzes the current time and foresees its evolution for the following days, while the climatologist studies the average time of a particular region, or even on a global scale and, using computational models, prepares antevisions of what could happen in the medium and long term, and the period is covered to reach dozens of years. While characterizing time in a particular place or region it is necessary to know the various weather parameters (temperature, moisture, atmospheric pressure, wind, cloudiness, precipitation, etc.) at a given time or a short period, to characterize the climate with the predominant time for relatively long periods. According to the world weather organization, this period should be at least thirty years. Returning to the different between Trump and meteorologists, their interpretation in the functions of these professionals and the institutions where they develop their activity may be the reflection of their vengeful character or by the fact that it is simple, not being able to love the storms (or intensify them), or determine when phenomena such as El-Niño, La Niña, monsoons, etc., should be beginning or ends. On the other hand, with the help of the oligarchs that have gained power in the US, the second country that most emits greenhouse gases (GHG) can certainly influence the climate. As? You can ask. The answer is simple. It is proven that the combustion of fossil fuels (oil, natural gas and mineral coal) is largely responsible for increasing the concentration of GHGs in the atmosphere, the main cause of climate change since the beginning of the industrial age. Since Trump is reversing all laws in the US that advocates the reduction of the use of such fuels, the gee concentration will continue to increase significantly, which will contribute to accentuating these changes. The weather will probably resent the measures being taken, including the cutting of funds in all that relates to the study of climate change and their consequences. The intensification of “drill, baby, drill”, as he likes to repeat, will contribute to the imbalance that the climate is being targeted. The various components of the climate system, especially the atmosphere, the biosphere, the cryiosfera and the hydrosphere will continue to suffer the consequences of the non -accepting of the recommendations of thousands of scientists, through the IPCC, the Kyoto Protocol, the 29 COP (Conference of the Parties) agreement, etc. The atmosphere is increasingly impregnated with GEE, the biosphere is degrading with the increasingly frequent forest fires; The oceans increase in salinity caused by acid rain and the absorption of carbon dioxide; The Criosfera ice fusion rate is increasing, which has the most serious consequence of increasing sea level. The unknown with which the current US administration deals with the issues associated with the climate and environment is such that, on the Official “Website” of the White House, an “Executive Order” with the title “Reinvigoring America’s Beautiful Clean Coal Industry and Amending Order 14241”, dated April 8, 2025, in which one of the most polluting industries is designated by “Beautiful Industry Charcoal clean". Megha Satyanarayana, chief editor of the opinion section of Scientific American magazine, recently asked "Why is the Trump Administration Politicizing Weather?" In her response, she associates the financial interest with Trump's attitudes and the oligarchy that has gained power. According to her, they are ending the disagreeing voices of the easy and fast profit policy that is based on the exploration of fossil fuels. The ongoing dismissal of scientists who develop their activity in the National Weather Service (NWS), department of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), is part of this effort to end the discordant voices of their policy. Hundreds of employees were failed in NOAA as a consequence of the application of the “2025 project”, which is no more than a series of measures aimed at reducing the number and size of state agencies, according to a conservative perspective. In its painful view, Trump administration does not see that, putting into practice this project, it is limiting the efficiency of an institution that has undoubtedly contributed to the safeguarding of lives and goods in a highly efficient way. Based on the information from the weather stations, the weather satellites and communications, the radars, the weather and climate forecast models, weather services are contributing to the prosperity of the countries where they operate. Millions of lives have been saved thanks to meteorological warning systems, based on which alerts about the evolution and approach of highly serious phenomena are prepared, such as tropical and extractic cyclones. An example of what the absence of weather information can cause, was what happened on September 8, 1900, when a hurricane hit the South Coast near Galveston in the Gulf of Mexico (Sorry Mr. Trump). At that time these storms were not yet designated by proper names, nor were sophisticated systems of meteorological warnings. About six thousand people succumbed victims to strong winds and the storm tide associated with the hurricane. This would not happen today, thanks to the progress that, however, national weather services have benefited. The creation of the worldwide meteorological organization in 1950, the increase in the number of weather stations, the use of weather radars and satellites, the progress of telecommunications and the efficiency of the time-friendly physical-material models, made not today possible consequences of such phenomena of this type. And all this thanks to the commitment, largely, the professionals of Meteorology. And it is these same professionals who currently suffer the destructive fury of the “project 2025”. Universities are also being victims of the state's cutting. Among these Sobresai the University of Harvard, where 161 Nobel Prizes were formed, including Albert Arnold Gore Jr., the 45th US Vice President (1993-2001), which was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2007 (together with the IPCC), due to the work developed in the dissemination of knowledge about climate change. According to IPCC reports, there is a close relationship between increased concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere and the frequency and intensity of heat waves, droughts and forest fires. The implementation of the “project 2025” may make a kind of “boomerang” effect contribute to climate deterioration, which will imply that the second most polluting country also suffers the consequences. item.title: Chinese musical instrument conference in Mafra

item.title: Must | “Hug of Love” and other works, by Leong Kit Man, on display
item.description:
The University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must, in the English acronym) hosts until Sunday the show of Leong Kit Man, with several paintings, where the creation “Hug of Love” stands out. These are works funded by the Young Talent Support Program of Artistic Creation of the National Arts Fund of China, in its edition of 2024, curated by Julia Kwan
Leong Kit Man, a young local artist, exposes his work "Hug of Love" until this Sunday at the University of Science and Technology of Macau (Must, in the English acronym). It is a large painting, with 4.8 by 4.8 meters, the result of an artistic project funded by the Youth Talent Support Program of Artistic Creation of the China National Arts Fund of 2024. According to a Must statement, this is a painting where flowers and birds gain prominence, breaking “with the traditional composition of topographic painting”. According to a curator's note, Julia Lam Tsz Kwan, the artist “unites [in painting] human landscapes and a centenary tree in a vision through segmented color blocks, with diverse elements, including the ancestral tree that symbolizes the life cycle, nests that symbolize homes, creation of pups that represent the adoption and inheritance, and precede plates that evoke prayers”. All of these elements “mean human growth”, read in the same note. In addition to this great picture, the public can also see “six original large -scale paintings of flowers and birds, along with preparatory designs, sketches and color studies of the artist”. The show also includes “a special digital animation” framed with the painting “Hug of Love”. This set of works indicates that “beyond the technical inheritance, the evolution of Chinese painting is in line with the continuous pioneering of new artistic expressions”. All of these works can be seen free of charge on the fourth floor of Must's block. Style In the same note, it is noteworthy that Leong Kit Man has been looking for more than a decade for over a decade, “merging the gongbi-style meticulous brush, with textures material, in order to obtain a distinct style, while exploiting and expanding infinite possibilities of the oriental [artistic] media”. It should be noted that the Gongbi style is, in Chinese painting, synonymous with detail and precision in how the various elements are portrayed, in order to give a sense of great realism to those who look at the works. For this style of painting, specific brushes are used in order to obtain certain types of lines and contours, according to the objective that the artist wants to achieve. Mo Xiaoye, exhibition advisor and professor at the Department of Fine Arts at Zhejiang University of Science and Technology, said that the play “Hug of Love” represents “from a single perspective, the Macau Peninsula seen from far from Cotai”. For the academic, this painting also allows “a highly creative and successful rereading of Macau's topographic painting, breaking with conventional formats”. The artist herself explains that this work "has as its backdrop the urban landscape of Macao dramatically transformed 25 years after the transfer [Portuguese administration from Macau to China], with a centenary tree as a central piece to look at us, who passed through it." Doctorate in Fine Arts from the National Academy of Arts of China, artist, academic and curator, Leong Kit Man is assistant teacher of Fine Arts and Master's Supervisor and PhD at the Faculty of Humanities and Arts of Must. The artist also had works selected for the China National Art Exhibition in 2014, 2019, and 2024. Highlight for the work “Emplendor Efémeus”, which was chosen to join the Exhibition of Select Works of the National Exhibition of Fine Arts of 2019 in Beijing. The artist won several awards at Macau's annual visual arts exhibition.

item.title: Macau Biennial | IC accepts submission of proposals until the 23rd

item.title: Taipa Village | Frank Lei Exhibition on Exhibition from Tomorrow
item.description:
The Vila da Taipa Cultural Association presents tomorrow “Frank Law: Cuba 92”, an exhibition of photography dedicated to the artist based in Macau and deceased in 2022. Here is the opportunity to see images of Cuba 1992, never before shown, in which it is a tribute to Frank Lei
He was born in Beijing and since he had lived in Macau. Frank Law, a man dedicated to the arts and photography, died in 2022 victim of prolonged illness, but is now entitled to a tribute through the display of his work. This is the exhibition “Frank Law: Cuba 92”, evident from tomorrow, and until July 9, at the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, with unpublished images captured by law in Cuba, in 1992. According to a statement from the organization, Frank Lei passed away leaving "a vast set of photographic works that remain little known to the general public." In this way, this show was born of the joint effort of family, friends and, above all, Alan Ieong Chon Weng, one of the founders of the Dialect group, dedicated to photography. “In 1992, Frank Law first traveled to Cuba, visiting not only the capital, Havana, but also Santiago de Cuba, in the eastern part of the island, demonstrating his deep attention and exploitation of Cuban culture and community,” says the organization, not only the artist launched not only an exhibition, but also a book with these images, with the name “Cuba Cuba”. This project included “selected works, filmed in color diaper”, constituting “the core of a narrative that presented a vibrant and living impression of the island nation”. In addition, Frank Law files on Cuba "include a set of unpublished black and white photographs, monochrome images that capture everyday life and the emotions of the Cuban people from a more subtle and contained perspective." Now, with this new exhibition, the display of these black and white images never revealed to the public "offers a new window in time and space, allowing the viewer to know the island's landscape that so much captivated the soul of Frank and which constitutes the invisible side of his trip to Cuba." "The initiative to bring to light these works is a recognition of the relevance of photography to document human realities and the circumstances of people's lives. Spectators have the opportunity to revisit Frank's works not only, but also to embrace the emotions they evoke about the survival of a society and a country as a Cuba," the organization highlights. Quoted by the same note, João Ó, architect and president of the Vila da Taipa Cultural Association, said it was “an honor to collaborate with Dialect to present this unprecedented collection of black and white photographs of Frank to Cuba's trip”. “The selection of photographs pays tribute to Frank's singular dedication to artistic and cultural creative industries over the years and shows the passion for Cuban culture that has impregnated his heart and soul,” he adds. A man from Macau Born in Beijing, Frank came to Macau at the age of ten. He graduated in journalism and worked as a reporter in the newspaper or Mun after the degree. Then he fell in love with the French cinema of the so-called “New Vacancy”, having gone to Paris to study cinema and video at the University of Sorbonne in 1991. In the same year, he was admitted at École Nationale Supérieure des Arts Décoratifs de Paris, where he studied photography, and also won the first award in the International Photography Contest “Life on the Street”, organized by the Musée de La Photographie. Frank Lei exposed his images on the Grand Palais de Paris, being part of the permanent collection of Musée de la photographie. In 1992, Frank traveled to Cuba to work in artistic projects and even waved to President Fidel Castro, highlights the organization of the exhibition. He then returned to Macau, where he taught at the School of Arts of the Macao Polytechnic Institute, today Macao Polytechnic University. “Cinema, photography, music and literature were Frank's passions throughout his life and, right after his return to Macau, embraced Buddhism, bringing a simple and vegetarian lifestyle,” he says. Frank Law was exposing his work in France, Macau and Hong Kong. In 1995, he founded the Macao Pedra Commune Artistic Group. In 2004, two years after his first exhibition about Cuba, it was found that Frank suffered from cancer in his brain. After treatment, he returned to the then Macao Polytechnic Institute, continued to work in the ox warehouse and began drawing extensively during his recovery. In 2006, he published the photographic anthology “walking and observing” with Pin-to Books. He continued to photograph and create paintings, organizing individual exhibitions and small painting exhibitions, and traveled to New York, South Korea and France for exchanges and photographic shows. In early 2017, Frank was invited to Strasbourg Art Photography, a permanent festival of photography in France, for a photographic exhibition and an exchange. After the disease, Frank Law died on May 18, 2022.

item.title: Auditors of Macau company accused of accounting accounts
item.description: Four Wellink CPA auditors and consultants are accused of having falsified Huarchi Global Group Holdings Limited accounts so that this Macao company could enter the Hong Kong bag. The case was revealed yesterday through a Hong Kong Independent Commission Against Corruption (ICAC) and is also being investigated in Macao. According to the results of the investigation that took place since 2021, auditors and consultants Lam Shui-Mei, Siu Yuen-Shan, Cha Wai-Lun and Wong Yat-Chung falsified Huarchi Global accounts to show fictitious economic growth and be admitted to the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. In addition, the four asked for the help of three family members, identified as Li Man-Heung, Li Kit-Chit and Wong Wing-Man, to subscribe to the company's first public offering. According to the Commissioner Against Corruption (CCAC), which assisted the ICAC in investigations, those involved in the purchase of shares received $ 1.5 million from Hong Kong. As a result, the four are accused of two conspiracy crimes to defraud the Hong Kong bag, while the three family members are accused of a conspiracy crime to defraud the Hong Kong bag. The seven will be present throughout this day to a Hong Kong court. However, the ICAC has admitted that investigations are still running and that there may be other accusations. Investigation in Macau In Macao, searches were performed at the headquarters of Huarchi Global Group Holdings Limited in the Plaza Civil Building. The president of the group appears identified in the 2021 company annual report as Lou Cheok Meng. The identity was not confirmed by the Macao corruption commissioner, who in a statement of the case confirmed that he was running an independent investigation in Macau. "This construction company is a local Macao company and its official is also a resident of Macao, so CCAC has established an investigation process following the respective indications of crime," he was reported. In addition, CCAC reported that the case continues to be investigated in the territory.

item.title: CITIGROUP | Trade war is still passing by
item.description:
In early May, the great gamblers moved to the casinos of the territory. Citigroup admits that it may have somehow assisted revenge expenses, that is, intense consumption after periods of deprivation
In the early days of May, the impact of trade war between the US and China was not felt but casino tables. The scenario was outlined by the Citigroup Investment Bank, in the latest report on the game sector. The May 1st holiday coincides with the Golden Week in the countryside, one of the main vacation periods, and despite the most complicated economic environment worldwide, players, including VIP, did not fail to come to Macao. According to Citigroup, quoted by the GGR Asia portal, the “current commercial conflicts between China and the United States seem not to be discouraging players to enjoy gaming offers and non -Macao's playing elements,” he is written. Analysts George Choi and Timothy Chau even go further and consider that the observations made in the casinos were to leave “the jaw drop”, given the number of players. For this reality contributed the number of great gamblers, those who make bets over $ 1 million of Hong Kong per play, which were present at the tables. Analysts even hypothesized that they have assisted “revenge expenses”, an expression used to describe intense and high consumption after moments of deprivation. "It was the first time we came across more than a VIP player to bet several million dollars of Hong Kong the same day," they noted. "This probably suggests that current commercial conflicts between China and the US are not so far affecting players' preferences," Citi suggested. Full house However, it was not only in terms of VIP players that the game market showed a great vitality. The same happened at the mass level, with Citigroup indicating that the number of visitors, in the order of 220 thousand per day, presented averages higher than those of the Lunar New Year, another of the high seasons of tourism. Given these values, Citigroup indicates that the numbers show that there is a certain “lack of elasticity of demand for the game”, that is, that the demand for the game tends to suffer few variations, despite being affected by negative factors. In terms of market share among the six dealers, and taking into account the highest segment in the mass market, the premium segment, analysts pointed out that Sands China, Wynn Macau and MGM China get 63 percent of the market, with galaxy, Melco and SJM to get the remaining 37 percent. This trend was considered as within the expected. The bank also indicated that MGM China “jumped to first place with a quota of approximately 30 percent of observed premium mass bets” due to the presence of a great gambler who was betting about $ 2.9 million from Hong Kong.

item.title: Myanmar | Reduction of requests for help to Macau since April

item.title: Zone A | Air quality monitoring station in the gutter
item.description:
An air quality monitoring station in zone A of new landfills will be built. Regarding air quality, the SMG director referred to the descent of the atmospheric pollutants concentration in 2023, according to data from the large bay monitoring network. This although the quality air got worse in Macao in 2023 and 2024
After a sequence of dangerous or unhealthy air quality days, which even motivated the alert of meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) for the population to avoid going out, the body's director reported improvements in the air quality verified in 2023 at regional level. In a response to the written interpellation of Congressman Leong Weng Kun, he highlights the results of the regional levels and the work of the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau air quality monitoring network to the Rio das Pearl Delta region. ” According to the SMG director, the 2023 report of the interregional network points out that “the annual average concentration values ​​of various atmospheric pollutants recorded by 2023 fell between 17 and 86 percent over peak levels”. Leong Weng Kun concludes that "emission reduction measures implemented by the three regions were effective in improving regional air quality." However, the annual statistics of the 2023 and 2024 environment of Macau paint a very different scenario. In 2023, more days were recorded with poor air quality compared to the previous year. In fact, the days with “unhealthy” and “moderate” air were much superior to those with “good” quality. The panorama worsened last year, according to environmental statistics the number of days with “unhealthy” and “very unhealthy” air quality increased to 2023. Beyond oxygen The SMG director also emphasizes the study prepared by the three regions to understand the causes of ozone in the large bay region and the transmission characteristics at the interregional level. Despite the descent of air quality, Leong Weng Kun states that "in recent years, the Government of MSAR has implemented a number of measures to improve air quality, including reducing atmospheric pollutants through incentive and regulation measures, aiming at ozone precursors." The official gives the examples of the prohibition of import and transit of paints for construction, inks for vehicles and stickers for decoration works high with volatile organic compounds. Regarding the monitoring of atmospheric pollution, Leong Weng Kun reveals that the preparatory work is currently “currently under way” to build an air quality monitoring station in zone A of new urban landfills ”.

item.title: Zone A | Worker and excavator fall into the sea
item.description:
The consortium of the companies Top Builders and state China Road and Bridge Corporation is responsible for the works of connecting to the peninsula, for which it will receive 608.8 million patacas. The proposal of these companies exceeded 80 million other participants in the contest
Photo: A worker and a large excavator fell into the sea on Friday morning after the collapse of a provisional bridge for the construction of the A3 connection between zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula. The accident was captured in images, which ended up shared on social networks. The claim happened in less than 20 seconds. The man was thrown into the sea because he was inside the excavating machine that had made the temporary structure not stand. It was eventually saved with the help of their colleagues, who shot him a float, already after being able to get out of the machine, still in the sea. Hours later, in a statement, the Directorate of Public Works Services (DSOP), the Directorate of Maritime and Water Affairs Services (DSAMA) and the Directorate for Labor Services (DSAL) confirmed the accident and the existence of slight injuries. "At the shipping and construction of the access road (A3) between zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula, there was an incident in which a building machine and its operator fell into the sea, due to the partial collapse of the provisional easel bridge, and the operator left the sea by himself and was transported to the hospital by the contractor." “It is preliminary to the operator involved was slightly injured and was conscious after the incident, and will undergo a detailed medical inspection,” he was added. The authorities also considered that the incident had “great importance” and asked for a total suspension of the work. In turn, DSSA has ensured that the worker will help compensation for the successful, since it suffered mild injuries, while DSOP has required the “contractor and the supervisory entity to fully collaborate with the administration in the investigation of the causes of the incident”. Sanctions were also promised, if it considered that there was a responsibility of the two parties. MILLION WORK The construction of the A3 connection between the zone A of the new urban landfills and the Macao Peninsula has as its contractor the consortium consisting of the companies Top Builders and the state China Road and Bridge Corporation. These won the public tender for the construction of the work for 608.8 million patacas, promising to do the work in 855 days. The proposal was the fourth cheapest of the 10 presented, and all had a time of doing the 855 -day work. However, at least one of the proposals, presented by the consortium consisting of the Ming Shun Building and Building Investment Company and Long Chon Construction and Engineering Society promised to do the same work by 528.0 million patacas, a difference of over 80 million patacas.

item.title: Zelensky vs Zelensky
item.description:
10/27/22 A renovated Ukrainian, with the same name of the president, guilty Zelensky about the extension of the conflict that destroyed his village. Zelensky, the village, who has never left his land, now lives mortified because his favorite gravedigger died in the bomber. This Zelensky, the village, represents half the world that reproves the other Zelensky, the villain, for not wanting to negotiate with Putin. Negotiate what? A peace that is not worthy is but a cessation of rights. As severe as Russophobia that Putin inflicts his people.
10/28/22 In a lunch with several guests I hear a friend, who declares himself a spiritist, explaining about the particularities of his belief, in a serene and balanced way, would even say, without "irrationalism". He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim committed himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Nobel and others
item.description: 9/10/22 Reading many people's reactions when the Nobel Prize in this year's literature was announced, I couldn't help but remind me of this repair of Jean-Pierre Siméon, in relation to another Nobel Prize: “An editor of a large national newspaper wrote five lines of indignation because the Nobel Prize for Literature, a complete stranger. item.title: Gaza | Hamas warns that it is not worth negotiating new truce
item.description: A high Hamas employee said yesterday that the Palestinian group considers it useless at this stage negotiations for a truce in Gaza, and appealed to the world to press Israel to end the “hunger war” at the enclave. "It is not worth starting negotiations or examining new ceasefire proposals while the Hunger War and the Gaza Extermination War continues," France-Presse (AFP) Bassem Naïm, a member of the Hamas political office, told the agency. "The world must press the government of Netanyahu to end the crimes of hunger, thirst and murder," he added. The statements appear a day after the Israelite government announced a new military campaign in the Gaza Strip, which provides for the conquest of the territory. The Gaza Strip, where the inhabitants have been displaced several times, has been under a blockade of Israel since March 2 and crosses a serious humanitarian crisis. Gaza Civil Defense spokesman Mahmoud Baçal said yesterday that three Palestinians were killed following Israeli bombing at dawn in different parts of the Gaza Strip. The Israelite army resumed the enclave offensive on March 18, ending a two -month truce. The war was triggered by Hamas's unprecedented attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, which caused the death of 1,218 people on the Israeli side, mostly civilians, according to an AFP count based on official data. Of the 251 kidnapped people, 58 remain arrested in Gaza, 34 of which were declared killed by the Israelite army. Hamas also maintains the remains of an Israeli soldier killed during a previous war in Gaza in 2014. The Israeli retaliation campaign made at least 52,567 killed in Gaza, most of Civil, according to Hamas Ministry of Health, considered UN reliable.

item.title: Victory Day | China sends guard of honor to parades in Moscow
item.description: The China army will send a guard of honor to the Victory Day parades in Moscow, where Chinese President Xi Jinping should attend the Russian homologist Vladimir Putin in Red Square. The China Ministry of Defense announced on Monday that it will send a guard of honor to participate in the military parades in the capitals of Russia and Belarus, to mark the 80th anniversary of the defeat of Germany Nazi, which is celebrated this Friday. Beijing sent Moscow Honor Guards to a Victory Day commemorative parade in 2015, but this will be the first time a Chinese guard of honor will participate in a similar event in Minsk. According to Chinese analysts, the gesture aims to demonstrate support for the International Order of Post World War, which Beijing considers to be under threat. Videos released on Chinese social networks showed the rehearsals of Chinese soldiers in Minsk and Moscow last week. As part of the preparations for the Moscow Parade, Chinese soldiers rehearsed the “Guerrilla Song” in Red Square on Sunday, described the Global Times, the Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper. The patriotic song describes the difficulties faced by Chinese soldiers during the Japanese invasion. Official News Agency Xinhua said this year is important to China and Russia, as well as “all those who love peace around the world,” as it also marks the 80th anniversary of the end of the invasion of Japan in China. Xinhua added that China and Russia will "defend written history with blood and lives, and oppose any attempt or behavior that seeks to deny, distort or falsify the history of World War II." Beijing had already announced that Xi will visit Russia between Wednesday and Saturday, and will maintain a “strategic dialogue” with Putin.

item.title: Tourism | Travel increases 6.4 percent during May holidays
item.description: China registered about 314 million domestic trips during the extended weekend of International Workers Day (May 1), a homologous growth of 6.4 percent, according to data released yesterday. Tourist expenses also increased this year, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism said, reaching 180.3 billion Yuan, an increase of 8 percent compared to the previous year. Authorities had already foreseen an increase in tourist activity during vacation from May 1-5, with reservations pointing to a preference for long -range trips within the country. The Asian country registered about 10.89 million entry and exit trips during the holiday, an increase of 28.7 percent over the same period of 2024, according to the National Immigration Administration. The tourism sector, one of the most affected by the Covid-19 pandemic and the covid zero policy, which has closed the borders of the Asian country for three years, is one of the great hopes of the Chinese government to boost consumption and strengthen sectors such as restoration, transport and retail trade. In March, the government released an action plan with guidance to ensure a favorable environment for consumption, for which it designed proposals such as the protection of labor rights in terms of rest and vacation, the improvement of commercial infrastructure and the reduction of consumer restrictions. According to official data, the world's second largest economy met 5 percent growth in 2024, but analysts continue to point out problems such as weak internal and international demand, trade war, insufficient stimuli, a prolonged real estate crisis and the lack of confidence of consumers and private sector.

item.title: Gaza | Beijing expresses deep concern about Israel's plan to widen offensive
item.description: China expressed profound concern yesterday with the situation in the Gaza Strip and expressed its opposition to the plans announced by the Israeli government to expand military operation at the Palestinian enclave. "China is deeply concerned about the current situation in Gaza and opposes the continuation of Israel's military operations in that region," Lin Jian's Ministry of Foreign Ministry spokesman said yesterday during a press conference in Beijing. Lin appealed to all parties to effectively implement the ceasefire agreements and resume "the right way" towards a political solution to the conflict. Israel's Security Office approved in the early hours of Monday a new document that foresees, among other points, the permanent occupation of territories in the track, the forced displacement of the population to the south and a new system of humanitarian aid distribution, rejected by the UN and all humanitarian organizations present on the ground. As part of its broader position, China defended last week before the International Court, that Israel "has no sovereignty" about the occupied territories and, therefore, cannot veto the work of organisms such as the United Nations Palestinian Refugee Assistance Agency (Unrwa), which he called the "spine column" of humanitarian aid in Gaza. Beijing has insisted that the solution is due to the respect of international law, the end of collective punishment to the civilian population and the defense of the principle of the two states. The Israeli attacks on Gaza have caused more than 52,200 dead in the year and a half of conflict triggered by Hamas attacks to Israel in October 2023.

item.title: EU | XI asks for Union against “unilateral intimidation” and reinforcement of partnership
item.description: On a day of celebration of the 50th anniversary of diplomatic relations, the Chinese president calls for the reinforcement of bilateral relations between China and the Old Continent in response to the new challenges posed by the US Administration Chinese President Xi Jinping said yesterday that China and the European Union should “oppose unilateral harassment” on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations, which coincides with commercial tensions with the United States. Xi stressed that the relationship between China and the EU is “one of the most influential bilateral relations in the world” and framed this bond in a global scenario marked by uncertainty. "Humanity is again in a historic crossroads," said the Chinese leader, who highlighted the role of bilateral cooperation as an international reference model. "A healthy and stable relationship between China and the EU not only benefits both parties, but enlightens the path of the world," he said. XI said it attributed great importance to the development of Brussels relations and expressed his desire to work with the president of the European Council, António Costa, and the president of the European Commission, Ursula Von de Leyen, to “deepen strategic communication, expand mutual opening and properly manage friction and disagreement”. The message, released yesterday, also included a response from European leaders, who highlighted the evolution of the bilateral relationship and expressed their willingness to “face shared challenges together and promote peace, safety and sustainable development,” said Chinese diplomacy. XI's appeal comes at a time when Beijing seeks to reinforce cooperation with Brussels to the growing pressure that is being targeted by Washington. Mutual Benefits China has repeatedly criticized the economic measures imposed by the United States - such as customs tariffs or technological restrictions - and has appealed to the EU to maintain an independent policy based on multilateralism and mutual benefit. Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang also exchanged messages with Costa and Von der Leyen, reaffirming Beijing's commitment to a "stable, constructive and mutual benefit" relationship. The anniversary celebration also coincided with the announcement of the full resuming of the legislative dialogue between Beijing and the European Parliament, after the mutual survey of the restrictions imposed in 2021. The Chinese Foreign Ministry reaffirmed yesterday that cooperation with the EU “weighs more than competition” at a time when both parties seek to preserve a common agenda in the face of increasing commercial tensions with the United States.

item.title: Hong Kong | HRW requires release from activist father
item.description: The Human Rights Watch organization yesterday called for the release of the Hong Kong Anna Kwok human rights defender, detained in late April, and denounced the harassment of territory authorities to family members of activists. Hong Kong police detained the father of the rooted activist in the United States Anna Kwok, "and accused him of a national security crime," he began writing in a statement to Human Rights Watch (HRW), which requires the release of Kwok Yin-Sang and being "immediately withdrawn all charges." Hong Kong National Security Police announced on Friday the arrest of Kwok's father and brother, accused of trying to manage the activist's financial resources. According to police sources, this is the first time that the controversial national security law is applied that criminalizes assistance to “designated fugitives” in the management of the assets that hold. According to the EFE agency on Friday, Hong Kong authorities detained 35 and 68-yearly Anna Kwok's brother and father in Tseung Kwan O district on April 30 and accused the last of trying to raise funds from an insurance policy on the name of their daughter, presenting documents with allegedly false signatures. Anna Kwok, 28, lives in the United States and is a executive director of the Hong Kong Democracy Council, a US -based non -profit organization and created to promote freedoms in China. Although the father remains detained, his brother, an employee of the insurance company who manages Kwok's policies, was released under bail and is being investigated for possible abuse of office to facilitate the operation. Also according to EFE, the authorities have reiterated the warning that anyone who collaborates with “designated fugitives” incurs heavy penalties that can go up to seven years in prison.

item.title: Xanana Gusmão asks Timorese to encourage children to learn Portuguese
item.description: The Prime Minister of Timor-Leste, Xanana Gusmão, asked yesterday from parents to encourage children to learn Portuguese, a language that is part of the Timorese identity. "To fathers and mothers, I ask you to encourage your children to learn Portuguese, because, according to our history, it is the Portuguese that represents our identity, not English, nor Indonesian," said Xanana Gusmão. The Timorese Prime Minister spoke at the Government Palace under the celebrations of the World Day of Portuguese Language and the Culture of the Community of Portuguese-Speaking Countries (CPLP) during an activity made by the Portuguese Embassy and the Timorese Ministry of Education, who gathered hundreds of students from the Learning and Formation Center (Cafe Schools), in a march to deliver books to Gusmão Xanana. The head of the Timorese government recalled that for 24 years of Indonesian occupation, the Portuguese language was not taught and that it is necessary to overcome that inheritance so that Timor-Leste does not risk being absorbed again by Indonesia. “Students should study and learn the Portuguese language, because it is the identity of Timor-Leste,” said Xanana Gusmão to the Timorese students, also asking them to thank Portugal for sending teachers. "For us, Timorese, teaching Portuguese is a little difficult, because we do not master the language well, but we thank the Portuguese government for the creation of coffee schools," he added. The project of the Learning and School Training Center or the Cafe Schools began in 2014, and is already present in the 12 Timorese Municipalities and the Oedusi Enclave, on the Indonesian side of Timor Island, and the extent of those educational establishments for administrative posts in the country is also foreseen. Those schools, where classes are given by Portuguese and Timorese teachers, are currently attended by more than 11,100 Timorese students. Cafe has two large pillars, namely quality teaching in the classroom and the complementary training of Timorese teachers. Share the future In those schools, the classes are taught in Portuguese, but students also have classes in Tetum, the second official language of Timor-Leste. Education Minister Dulce Soares stressed that Portuguese is a language of “affection, knowledge and future”. “This is where we share stories, build learning and open new ways,” said Dulce Soares, stressing that the Portuguese language represents diversity, creativity, identity and hope. "Promoting the Portuguese language is also to promote education, cooperation and development," he added. World CPLP World Language and Culture Day was also marked in the National Parliament with a ceremony, which included the attribution of poetry prizes to students, who won a contest to promote Portuguese learning.

item.title: China and Japan exchange accusations about Diaoyu Islands
item.description: China and Japan accused Sunday of an intrusion on Saturday in the airspace of islands played by the two countries in the East China Sea. The uninhabited islands, known as Diaoyu in China and Senkaku in Japan, are administered by Tokyo but claimed by Beijing, being a point of regular tension between the two countries. Chinese diplomacy announced Sunday that it presented a formal protest to the Japan embassy in Beijing, arguing that "a civil plane entered illegally in airspace around the Diaoyu islands." "The Diaoyu islands and the affiliated islands are a territory belonging to China, and we install Japan immediately ceasing all illegal activities," said Chinese Coast Guard spokesman Liu Dejun. Liu said “a ship-based helicopter” was mobilized to warn and expel the Japanese plane, according to France-Presse (AFP) news agency. Japanese Foreign Deputy Minister Takehiro Funakoshi, in turn, presented a "vigorous protest" to the Chinese ambassador in Tokyo. He cited the "intrusion of four Chinese coastal guard ships in the Japanese territorial waters around the Senkaku islands and the violation of Japanese airspace by a helicopter." According to the Japan Ministry of Defense, the Chinese helicopter invaded Japanese airspace for about 15 minutes. "The [Japanese] self -defense forces reacted by sending fighters," said the ministry, also quoted by AFP. According to Japanese public broadcaster NHK and other local media, it is the first time a helicopter of Chinese authorities violates Japanese airspace on dispute islands. Sides Tensions between China and other countries that claim territories in the Sea of ​​China led Japan to develop ties with the Philippines and the United States. Japanese Prime Minister Shigero Ishiba and Filipino President Ferdinand Marcos agreed on Tuesday to deepen security ties between the two countries. They also agreed to oppose “attempts to alter the 'status quo' in the East China Sea and the southern China Sea by strength or coercion,” in a reference to China.

item.title: Russia | Xi Jinping visiting the country from Wednesday to Saturday
item.description:
The visit of the Chinese president, along with other world leaders such as Lula da Silva, is part of the celebration of the day of victory over Germany Nazi in World War II. Ukraine and the international situation should be on the agenda of the XI meeting with Putin
Russia announced Sunday that Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit the country from Wednesday to Saturday in the 80th anniversary of World War II victory against Germany Nazi, also addressing the Ukrainian conflict. According to a statement issued Sunday by Kremlin and quoted by France-Presse (AFP), Xi Jinping will also participate in bilateral discussions on “the development of world partnership relations and strategic interaction” and “current problems in the order of International and Regional Day”. "It is expected that a series of bilateral documents, between governments and ministries, be signed," added the Kremlin. The visit takes place at a time of commercial confrontation between Beijing and Washington, reaffirming the alliance between Russia and China. In addition to Xi Jinping, leaders from about 20 countries are expected to attend the military parade on May 9 in Red Square, including Brazilian President Lula da Silva and other traditional international allies of Moscow. One of whom is Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel, who arrived Sunday in St. Petersburg, where he was received by local governor Alexandr Beglov. Threat exchange On Saturday, Kremlin accused Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky of threatening the celebrations of World War II on May 9 after stating that Kiev could not ensure the safety of international leaders in Moscow. Volodymyr Zelensky “made an unmistakable threat to world leaders” who will participate in the ceremony, Russian diplomacy spokesman Maria Zakharova said on social networks, according to Russian news agency Tass. Zakharova commented on statements made on Friday night by Zelensky about the celebrations of the 80th anniversary of the victory over Germany Nazi, presided by Vladimir Putin. Zelensky said Kiev could not guarantee the safety of the international leaders present, suggesting that Moscow can do something to blame Ukraine. "We do not know what Russia will do on that date. You can take several measures, such as fires or explosions, and then accuse us," said the Ukrainian President.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
item.description:

The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005.
